attributes.comment:
Please do not make us pay more for governmental fees on adoption paperwork,
adoption is expensive enough for families. Most families go into adoption trying to
make a small difference in the world. The red tape that these families have to go
through because of all governments is almost insurmountable but we forge on to
make sure a little one in a far away land has the opportunity for the best life
possible. We all understand that it cost money to adopt, but let's be realistic here,
raising your prices 66% is a lot of money. We are ripped off in gas, taxes, and
other items in the USA, help us stay a little ahead when it comes to our families.

Your customer services should be the item that you concentrate on, customer
service is lousy in some states. We waited a long time just to receive a one page
report saying we could adopt, and have not committed any gastly crimes. Then
when we finally get the report, it expires in 18 months, our finger prints expire in 15
months, which in most countries right now is not enough time to adopt a child.
Why are you not addressing this portion of the problem, like most of us parents
have ask for, instead of raising prices on yet another governmental item. Not only
did we pay a high price for the privelege of getting our fingerprints done, reviewed
and a report issued, we could not get a hold of anyone to find out where they were
in the process, they have no number to reach anyone at in that governmental office
and when I did get someone on the line, they yelled at me for 2 minutes for asking
a question. VERY POOR, you are our government, should be serving the people,
not the other way around.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Adopted Parents
